channel.title: Mocks
channel.description:
Btw - mocks = mock results in england schools for year 11 (They are like 6 months before the real exams to give you an idea how you are doing).
Well I thought I'd make this thread because I'm totally shocked at my english result.
Anyway English has always been one of my weakest subjects, I've always been predicted a D or below, which is fine because It doesn't interest me, wherease maths is my strongest subject (usually predicted an A)... anyways the past year I've been really shit in english, running up walls, laying on the floor, mocking my teachers religion by pretending to read a bible etc..
I found out I was allowed to do my english exam on the computer... so I gave it ago, well today I got my result for that an I got an A :S Highest in my year as well some how (though there are 30 people in my year). So i just thought I'd post how i beat the system (so far).
My mock results so far:
English - A Physics - B Biology - C
[Will be getting more results later]
Anyways if you are in year 11/10 then feel free to discuss gcse's and post your mock results!!!
Also feel free to post anything as long as it follows mitb rules (I'm open to anything, yes even gay porn)

item.title: Mocks
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

We have PLAN tests, I’m not sure what that stands for if it stands for anything, buts a practice for ACT [i think].
I’m proud to say I’m better than 100% of EVERYONE [who have taken the test] in the Algebra section :D.

Read full topic

item.title: Mocks
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Mocks don’t stand for anything. They are mock exams. Practice exams.

Read full topic

mocks obviously stand for something. Such as CAT(California Annual test or something)
Nobody in london is gonna go ‘At least we dont name them cats’

item.title: Mocks
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:18, topic:174120”][quote author=spankjava link=topic=234482.msg2005963#msg2005963 date=1200878264]
ive just had my year 10 scinece gcse in the mock for that i got a b but dreading year 11 onlythng i think ill pass is drama witch im a a* student
[/quote]
In my school, in my opinion, everything got so much easier in year 11, many things made me think this.

Not least the fact all the teachers bum lick me because they think that will encourage us to do good, and its wonderful being top of the school.

Got my full mock results now, bit bummed about a few and a bit suprised at a few, but overall pretty pleased

Maths - B
English Language - A
English literature - C
Drama - (Don’t do a mock for this)
Chemistry - E
Physics - B
Biology - C
Business studies - B
Music - A*
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 22, 2008, 03:04:34 PM[/size][hr][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=234482.msg2005374#msg2005374 date=1200863337]

So you guys will get on your relevent level when the exams start? Not earlier?

I don’t understand what you are saying?
Was it a question aimed at someone? Lmao

I was asking about this:

…so they can put you at the relevent level for the real exam.

So just before the exams begin you are put in the right level?
[/quote]

In my school there are 2 papers:

1 (The easier) Can only get a grade up to a C
2 (The harder) Can achieve up to an A*

The 1st paper is usually increadibly easier to get a C in than the 2nd paper.
So basically if you do really shit in the mock then it helps you to choose what paper to take, for example I for sure am
taking the lower paper for Chemistry as I only achieved an E.[/quote]
I got my exam results back today.
Spanish - C [pretty good, I have a very hard teacher]
English - A
Math - A
History - B
Biology - B
Computer - B

Read full topic

[/quote]

So just before the exams begin you are put in the right level?[/quote]

In my school there are 2 papers:

1 (The easier) Can only get a grade up to a C
2 (The harder) Can achieve up to an A*

The 1st paper is usually increadibly easier to get a C in than the 2nd paper.
So basically if you do really shit in the mock then it helps you to choose what paper to take, for example I for sure am
taking the lower paper for Chemistry as I only achieved an E.

item.title: Mocks
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:11, topic:174120”][quote author=cooper link=topic=234482.msg2004267#msg2004267 date=1200730649]

The year 10 Science and math exams are eeaassy peasy.

I agree stuff back then was so easy.(Or it seemed it, anyway!).

Got two more mock results today:
Chemistry - E (Well i thought it was my favourite, and best science but something seems to have fucked up lol).
Music - A (My teacher didn’t have a proper mark scheme so she just marked it how she thought it was right, so i think my actual grade is lower then an A… but still pretty good.)

=D quite pleased so far!

What kind of music is it?
For me I often will flip my grades.
I used to do horrible in math and amazing in english, and i ended up sucking on english and passing easily on math.
Now of course I do it all easily
[/quote]
Not sure what you mean by what type of music it is, its just the normal music sylabbus i think, the course is “AQA”

my bitchy maths teacher wont give us our maths or ict results (as she does both) because she says that she is going to wait till parents evening on thursday to tell our parents… fucking bitch.[/quote]
Haha yes, if they told us first we could warn our parents

Read full topic

item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Yea, they are just exams to make you get an idea of what the real exams are like and for the teachers to make sure your running at the level they are expecting you to get. so they can put you at the relevent level for the real exam.

item.description:

item.title: Mocks
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

I was shocked at my GCSE results… i got 2 d’s in science and thats with no coursework and no revision (i didnt do revision for any subject) yet in food tech which i really enjoyed i got an e… thats with FULL coursework

I think its because i like experimenting with chemicals and stuff and probably have a natural abilty to do stuff like that or something??

Read full topic
